meanings.definition: The sprout of a germinating grain seed.
meanings.sent1: The acrospire of the wheat seed slowly emerged from the soil.
meanings.sent2: The farmer examined the acrospire of the barley seed to check its growth.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the acrospire of the corn seed for a tiny tree.
meanings.sent4: The acrospire of the rice seed reached for the sun like a determined explorer.
meanings.sent5: The bright green acrospire of the oat seed stood out against the dark earth.

meanings.sent1: With the right conditions, the seed will acrospire and grow into a plant.
meanings.sent2: The garden acrospired with new life after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The idea began to acrospire in his mind, growing into a full-fledged plan.
meanings.sent4: Her talent acrospired quickly, surprising everyone with its rapid development.
meanings.sent5: Hope acrospires in the hearts of those who believe in a better future.
